Special epic spells from spell focuses:
Spell Focus: Abjuration
Each Spell Focus in Abjuration grants a cumulative +2 to Dispelling Rolls,
With Spell Focus: Abjuration, the Shield spell protects against Isaac's Lesser Missile Storm as well as Magic Missile. With Greater Spell Focus, this protection extends also to Isaac's Greater Missile Storm.
With Epic Spell Focus: Abjuration, the -ward and -ward teleport Commands become available. The character may use one or the other of these, once per rest. -ward creates a large visible symbol on the floor, which lasts for a long time and inflicts brief paralysis on enemies who fail a Will Save upon passing over it. -ward teleport, while it lasts, prevents any PC from teleporting out of the area in question through any means, and prevents them from being -yoinked elsewhere whilst the remain in the area. It also prevents travel to any portals within the area.

Spell Focus: Conjuration
Greater Spell Focus: Conjuration causes a caster to summon a creature one "level" higher than normal when using the Summon Creature I-VIII spells, in the same way as the bonus provided by the Cleric's Animal Domain. Note that Animal Domain and Greater Spell Focus: Conjuration do not stack in this respect.
Epic Spell Focus: Conjuration enables the -yoink command. Once per rest, a character may send -yoink as a tell to another PC, which will cause them to enter a dialogue telling them that your PC is attempting to summon them. If they accept, they are transported instantly to your location.

Spell Focus: Divination
Spell Focus: Divination allows a character using the *looks* command to see whether a character is "attuned" to Life, Death, Fire, Water, Earth, or Air. This information is displayed even if the target is disguised.
With Epic Spell Focus: Divination, the -scry command becomes available. Once per rest, with the Clairaudience/Clairvoyance spell active, the character may send -scry as a tell to another PC (or type -scry [START OF TARGET'S NAME]). This permits the character to spy on their target for roughly one minute. It is possible to protect against this, but means of doing so are considered Find Out In Game information.

Spell Focus: Evocation
Epic Spell Focus: Evocation drastically improves both Spell: Greater Ruin and Spell: Hellball, to several times their normal effectiveness. Without this focus, their power is equivalent to Vanilla NWN.

Spell Focus: Necromancy
Greater Spell Focus: Necromancy turns Summoned Undead (from any Spell, Class Ability or Feat except Epic Spell: Mummy Dust) into Henchmen. Your character may therefore use such an ability twice (or two such abilities once), and have two undead at the same time. You may also have a normally summoned creature in addition to those two.
Epic Spell Focus: Necromancy means that all abilities which summon undead summon two, with one casting.

Transmutation allows teleporting (which can be done with items), enchanting lowers price of items and ilusion allows to send copy of character to someone with message.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Here are my suggestions. Somebody else will probably come along and offer better or more complete suggestions.
Drop Bard from the build, making do without UMD and with only 15 points cross-trained into Tumble. The 3 additional levels of Cleric will make you a more powerful caster and will give you another Cleric bonus feat for Great Ruin.
Wait until level 27 to take the 4th level of Fighter for two reasons. You cannot take Epic Weapon Spec on a Cleric level, so this way you get Weapon Spec and Epic Weapon Spec at the same time. Also, this change would cost you the 4th attack, which you will get back with Divine Power at the same AB as your first attack, instead of -15.
Divine power will raise your STR to 18, so only put one +1 into STR, and all 6 remaining +1s into WIS, ending with STR 15 and WIS 26. Either that, or put all 7 into WIS and use the Cleric 26 bonus feat for Great WIS to end with WIS 28. This will make you a more powerful caster.

Another idea would be to go pure Cleric. You would lose the Fighter feats, which would mean that in order to keep Blind Fight and Weapon Focus, you would have to lose the second line of Spell Focus feats, but then you would free another feat to take Empower Spell, but probably not until epic levels. This would also grant you yet another Cleric Bonus feat, so you could take both Greater Ruin and Great Wisdom.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
You could always be a DEX-based Cleric / Monk / Rogue, for example. Then you would have Wisdom to increase your AC, a better choice of weapons, 30% speed bonus, full Tumble and UMD, and could grab Zen Archery. You'd need to give up one of the SF lines, but that wouldn't matter much. This would also mean you'd be able to attack the targets when they approached you, which with Cleric buffs means death. Called shot would also be wise to slow your targets.

Cleric 24 Monk 3 Rogue 3 would do the trick, you'd be undispellable, lose the Cleric 27 Bonus Feat and get FULL UMD and Tumble.
